Morning Star Adoption Center
15635 W. 12 Mile Rd.
Southfield, MI. 48076-3048
Re: License #: CB630246843
Dear Ms. Lukowski:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
July 20, 2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Linda Tansil, area manager at (248) 860 – 0780.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas.
• No technical assistance was provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The focus of the onsite entrance conference held on 7/20/2023 was numerous
barriers the agency faces with adoption. The Chief Administrator reported that the
agency finds that adoptive applicants have difficulty gathering and providing
required documents in a timely manner to move the home studies towards
completion. Other barriers were identified as the length of time it takes the court
to process the legal portion of the adoption before finalization. Slow mail delivery
was another barrier. However, the administrator reported that they have added a
home study document upload button to their website which provides their
applicants the opportunity to scan and upload their completed documents and this
process works well. The administrator reported that this process serves as a
safety net for applicants should their documents get lost in the mail. The
administrator also reported that the agency has an online training platform for all
adoptive applicants.
Financial Overview
The agency provided their annual budget, a copy of the nonprofit tax return from
the previous fiscal year and their annual audit, all was reviewed on site. There
were no concerns noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed. The staff reported they enjoy working at the agency
and working with the families. Staff reported no concerns or suggestions for
improvement.
There were no youth interviews.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency has adequate space and equipment. Case files are stored in locked
cabinets which prevent unauthorized access.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency does not have any licensed foster homes or relative placements.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that Morning Star Adoption Center
continue on their regular license.
8/1/2023
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
8/2/23
Linda D Tansil Date
Area Manager
4
